did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Office Files of David Bonbright
did.abstract: The Office Files of David Bonbright, Assistant Program Officer (1983-1986) and Program Officer (1986-1987) of the Ford Foundation's Developing Country Programs (DCP), document his oversight of grantmaking and administration of field offices throughout Africa, with an emphasis on his work in developing a Foundation portfolio in South Africa. The collection spans 1979-1987 and consists of correspondence and subject files. The records were transferred to the Ford Foundation Archives in 1991, and were fully processed in 2006. The arrangement of the collection follows the original order established by David Bonbright.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: David Bonbright was Assistant Program Officer (1983-1985) and Program Officer (1986-1987) of the Ford Foundation's Developing Country Programs. His areas of responsibility were South Africa, regional African grants, and New York support for African field offices. With DCP Vice President William Carmichael, Bonbright represented the Foundation at meetings of the Study Group on Southern Africa, a committee of foundation and university executives convened by the Carnegie Corporation to promote better educational opportunities for black South Africans.

bioghist.head: Organizational history
bioghist.p: The administration of Ford Foundation international programs was restructured in 1980-1981, and a new office for Developing Country Programs (DCP) was created. DCP coordinated the work of Foundation field offices overseas, and of New York-based staff responsible for grants to developing countries. David Bonbright oversaw DCP work throughout Africa during 1983-1987, and played a key role in the development of the Foundation's South Africa portfolio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Office Files of David Bonbright document Developing Country Program grantmaking and program administration throughout Africa during the period 1979-1987. A substantial portion of the collection relates to Ford Foundation policies towards, and activities in, South Africa.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Office Files of David Bonbright are arranged in two series:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains incoming and outgoing letters, memoranda and attachments that document Ford Foundation program development, grantmaking, grantee activities and administrative matters throughout Africa, with an emphasis on South Africa. Letters exchanged by Bonbright with South African political figures, leaders of the anti-apartheid movement, Ford Foundation leadership and others concerned with South African social and political conditions illuminate the activities of the Foundation and other philanthropies operating in the region. Collectively, these documents provide a vivid account of the political scene, current events, social and economic conditions, and philanthropic work across the region.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The correspondence is arranged chronologically, and is further sorted alphabetically within each year. Letters are filed by the individual recipient's last name, not by institutional name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains records related to meetings of the Ford Foundation Board of Trustees held in South Africa during 1982 and 1983, including briefing papers, background readings and grantee information. Also filed here are minutes and related documents of the Study Group on Southern Africa, a regular convening of foundation leaders, NGO staff, academics, political figures and others concerned with international policy towards the apartheid regime in South Africa and regional political issues. Also included are reports on African social and political conditions prepared by the scholar Thomas Karis, the Institute of Current World Affairs, and others organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by subject.
